Visual Studio 2017 and aboveNuGet Package Manager (PM UI and PM Console) is included with Visual Studio. Latest NuGet releases are delivered as part of Visual Studio updates.Note: nuget.exe itself is not included with any version of Visual Studio.
Do either of these let me publish a nuget package?  Or just install them in my project?  How can this be so difficult!!!  Last time, it felt like I right click published and I was done.  I didn't need to be downloading extra tools and adding yet ANOTHER THING To my gd path!!!!!   There are like 1000 characters available in a windows path, why on earth do I need to add ANOTHER FUCKING TOOL there just to upload these dll's.  This CAN'T be this fucking hard!!!!

I understand that you are frustrated, but let's try to approach this calmly. 

To publish a NuGet package, you need to have the `nuget.exe` command-line tool installed on your machine or use the NuGet Package Manager in Visual Studio.

If you choose to use the `nuget.exe` command-line tool, you can download it from the official NuGet website, and then run the `nuget push` command followed by the path to your `.nupkg` file. 

If you prefer to use the NuGet Package Manager in Visual Studio, you can right-click on your project, select "Manage NuGet Packages," navigate to the "Package Manager" tab, and click on the "Publish" button to upload your package.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any additional questions or concerns.
